alert.note: Alert for Clay; Laurel (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 4:01PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Laurel and Clay Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 401 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Pittsburg, or near London, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Langnau, Mcwhorter and Lesbas around 405 PM EDT. Portersburg, Crawford, Byron, Deer Lick, Fogertown, Benge, Marydell, Datha, Lake and Lida around 410 PM EDT. Sidell, Grace, Urban, Hooker, Pigeonroost and Bush around 415 PM EDT. Manchester, Bernice, Littleton, Fall Rock, Treadway, Mill Pond, Horse Creek Junction, Laurel Creek, Herron and Sibert around 420 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Tanksley, Hector, Wild Cat, Hensley, Seth, Boho, Ammie, Oneida, Goose Rock, Botto, Spurlock and Barcreek. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 32. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 36 and 48. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 6 and 11. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
